intro: Hieracium trebevicianum subsp. platyodontozoum, commonly known as the flat-toothed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are generally rough and hairy, with a serrated edge, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. The subspecies is distinguished by its broader, flatter teeth on the flower head compared to other hawkweed species.
